article_question:
[CLS]James is going to the baseball field with his friend Tommy.
ewline
ewlineJames has to practice because baseball season starts in a week.
ewline
ewlineHe wants to be a good player when the season starts.
ewline
ewlineJames has been lazy in practicing so he is not very good at baseball right now.
ewline
ewlineHe has to make up for it by playing baseball for 5 hours every day for a week.
ewline
ewlineJames thinks this is enough practice for him to catch up and be a good player when the
ewlineseason starts.
ewline
ewlineSo James and Tommy practice every day.  They throw the ball around.  They practice batting
ewlineand they practice fielding.
ewline
ewlineTommy begins to see that James is getting better every day.  He says "I do not believe it,
ewlineJames, but I think you are going to be pretty good when the season starts!"
ewline
ewlineUsually a week is not enough time to get pretty good at baseball but James is practicing
ewlineso much he is fitting a month of practice into one week.
ewline
ewlineThen James has a setback.  His glove rips during practice.  He can't keep playing with a
ewlinebroken glove!
ewline
ewlineSo Tommy and James go around town collecting bottles to trade in for five cents for each
ewlinebottle.
ewline
ewlineJames misses a day of practicing but they find enough bottles to turn in for thirty
ewlinedollars.
ewline
ewlineThis is enough money for James to buy a new glove!
ewline
ewlineSo James buys a new glove and he and Tommy go back to the field and practice some
ewlinemore.
ewline
ewlineBy the time the season comes James is one of the best players on his team.[SEP]What is James' friend's name?

[CLS]Billy had a pet turtle that he took good care of, everyday.  His turtle's name was
ewlineTumble.  Tumble liked to walk around outside in the garden and dig small holes to sleep
ewlinein.  Billy loved Tumble and would visit him outside when he got home from school.
ewlineTumble's favorite food was oatmeal.  So, every day after school, Billy would make Tumble a
ewlinebig bowl of oatmeal and take it outside for Tumble to enjoy.  Tumble would see Billy and
ewlinewalk up to him as fast as a turtle can go.  Billy would put the bowl down and wait for
ewlineTumble to come up to the bowl to eat from it. When Tumble reached the bowl, he put his
ewlinenose on it.  But, the oatmeal was too hot to eat.  Billy reached down and blew on the hot
ewlineoatmeal, to cool it down for Tumble to eat.  Once the oatmeal was cool enough, Tumble
ewlinecould dig in and eat his big bowl of oatmeal.  Billy loved to watch as Tumble ate his bowl
ewlineof oatmeal, because Billy took good care of Tumble, everyday.[SEP]Why couldn't Tumble eat his oatmeal, at first?
A: The oatmeal was too hot to eat
D: his nose was too big for the bowl

article_question:
[CLS]One day Billy and Sandy went to the neighborhood fair. They were so exited because this
ewlineyear Bob the clown was going to be there. They had heard a lot about Bob the clown, he was
ewlinefunny and knew a lot of balloon tricks. He always made the kids laugh and gave out small
ewlineprizes to many of the children at the fair. Billy and Sandy had even heard that sometimes
ewlineBob the clown would give out free cotton candy and candy apples. They had waited all year
ewlineand were so excited. They did all their chores and cleaned their rooms so they could go to
ewlinethe fair. When they got to the fair they were so happy to see that Bob the clown was
ewlinehanding out cotton candy and candy apples. Billy and Sandy waited in line and then once it
ewlinewas their turn Billy got a balloon in the shape of a dog and Sandy got a big bag of cotton
ewlinecandy. They were both happy and could not wait to tell their friends all about Bob the
ewlineclown.[SEP]What did Billy and Sandy have to do before they could go to the fair?
A: do chores and clean the kitchen
B: rake the lawn and clean their rooms
C: do their chores and clean their rooms
D: sweep the sidewalk and wash the dishes

article_question:
[CLS]John thought about things that he liked to do.
ewline
ewlineWell, for one, he liked baseball. Compared to his friends, he was very good at the
ewlinesport. He didn't even have to practice that much. He remembered that he once hit the ball
ewlineso hard that it flew out of the park. Home run!
ewline
ewlineHe was also a fan of basketball. He enjoyed watching people on television pull off crazy
ewlinetricks like slam dunking (but he didn't really like all of the passes). He wasn't quite
ewlinethat good yet, but he was pretty good at making shots from the three point line. He knew
ewlinethat if he kept practicing, he would be really great someday.
ewline
ewlineFinally, he loved football. Unlike baseball and basketball, he didn't play football
ewlinehimself, but he was drawn to the games. He got a kick out of sitting in the stands,
ewlinecheering on his team and friends. He once cheered so loud that he could barely speak at
ewlineall for the rest of the day.[SEP]Based on what John likes to do, what else do you think John would enjoy?

[CLS]Molly likes animals.
ewlineShe has a cat.
ewlineShe has a dog.
ewlineShe has a bird.
ewlineShe has a hamster.
ewlineShe has a bunny.
ewlineHer cat's name is Kitty.
ewlineHer dog's name is Spike.
ewlineHer bird's name is Polly.
ewlineHer hamster's name is Barry.
ewlineHer bunny's name is Snowball.
ewlineKitty plays with yarn.
ewlineSpike plays with a ball.
ewlinePolly plays in her cage.
ewlineBarry runs on his wheel.
ewlineSnowball eats carrots.[SEP]What does Molly like?

[CLS]Tim had always a red bike. His birthday party was coming up and he hoped that his parents
ewlinewould finally get him the bike. When his friends came over for the party, Tim was very
ewlineworried that he wouldn't get the bike. He looked at all the presents and none of them
ewlineseemed big enough to have a bike in them. Tim was sad. When it was time to open the
ewlinepresents he opened them one at a time. The first present was not a bike. The second
ewlinepresent was not a bike. The third present was the biggest one. Tim knew if the bike was
ewlinegoing to be in any of the presents it was going to be in this box. Tim opened it and there
ewlinewas no bike inside. Just as Tim tried not to look too upset, his Dad brought in the
ewlinebiggest present of them all. His Dad had been hiding the present all along. Tim opened it
ewlineand his new bike was inside the box. Tim put the bike together with his Dad's help.[SEP]What color was the bike Tim always wanted?

[CLS]Bailey and her friend Kara were bored one Saturday.  It was a hot summer day.  They didn't
ewlinewant to stay inside any longer but they didn't know what to do.  They were tired of
ewlinewatching TV inside.  Suddenly, Kara had an idea.  She said, "Bailey, we could make some
ewlinemoney."  "How?," asked Bailey.  "Well, it is hot outside," said Kara. "People are thirsty
ewlineout there.  We could make money by making some lemonade and iced tea and have people pay
ewlinefor it."  "That is a great idea," answered Bailey, "let's do it!" Kara had made some iced
ewlinetea with her mom earlier that day.  She asked her mom permission to use it.  Her mom said
ewlineyes.  She and Kara made two pitchers of lemonade.  They got a cooler full of ice and made
ewlinea sign so people knew what was for sale.  Kara's mom helped them get a table and chairs
ewlineand set up out on the corner in their neighborhood.  It was so hot out that people who saw
ewlinetheir stand came to buy drinks right away. Their first visitors to their stand were their
ewlinefriends, Abby and Molly.  In a half hour, they had to close their stand. They were all
ewlineout of lemonade and iced tea.  They had made a lot of money. They split the money and each
ewlinegot ten dollars.  It was a great day.[SEP]How many pitchers of lemonade did they make?

[CLS]James was a nice old man who lived by himself. Every day he would walk down the road by
ewlinehis house and say hello to everyone. It was fun saying hello to everyone but he felt
ewlinelonely sometimes. He wanted a pet to take care of. One day as he was walking down the road
ewlinea little brown and spotted puppy came up to him and wanted James to pet him. James reached
ewlinedown and petted the puppy and smiled. James hoped to see the puppy again. Many days later
ewlineJames went for a walk again. He thought to himself, "I guess I won't ever see the brown
ewlinepuppy again. I hoped to see him again." A nice young lady said to James, "Would you like a
ewlinepuppy?" James said, "I would like a puppy that was like the one I petted before." The
ewlinelady smiled. She was holding the little brown and spotted puppy. She told James that she
ewlinefound the little puppy in the woods. She said that the little puppy did not have a
ewlinefamily. James said happily, "I would love to give the puppy a home!" So James grabbed the
ewlinelittle brown and spotted puppy and took him home. James and the little brown puppy became
ewlinegreat friends. James named him Spotty.[SEP]Who gave James the puppy?

[CLS]Lulu is a little dog.  She likes to play with her toys.  She really likes her little lamb.
ewlineShe likes when Lauren throws her lamb.  Lulu likes to chases the lamb.  Lulu doesn't like
ewlineto bring the lamb back to Lauren.  Lauren gets mad. 
ewline
ewlineLulu likes to bark.  She barks at the children outside.  She barks when the mailman comes
ewlineto the door.  Lulu barks at everything.  Lulu barks all the time.  Daddy gets mad.
ewline
ewlineLulu likes to eat.  She likes her dog food.  Her dog food has a picture of dog that looks
ewlinelike her on the bag. Lulu likes her food, but she likes the cat's food better.  The cat
ewlinegets mad.
ewline
ewlineLulu likes to drink water.  Her favorite water bowl is in her cage.  Lulu likes that water
ewlinebowl because it's the right height.  Lulu likes her water bowl, but she likes Heather's
ewlineglass of water better.  Heather gets mad.
ewline
ewlineLulu likes her bed.  She goes there to rest.  She likes to sleep on the blanket there.
ewlineHer favorite blanket is from Grandma.  Lulu likes Grandma's blanket, but she likes Alan's
ewlinebetter.  Alan gets mad.
ewline
ewlineLulu curls up on the blanket on the couch.  Lauren gives Lulu her lamb to sleep with.
ewlineDaddy pets Lulu.  The cat licks Lulu.  Heather thinks Lulu looks sweet.  Alan lets Lulu
ewlineuse his blanket.  No one gets mad at Lulu.[SEP]What do Lauren and Alan give to Lulu to sleep with?
A: Lauren gives Lulu her doll and Alan gives Lulu his scarf
B: Lauren gives her a toy cat and Alan gives her Grandma's blanket
C: Lauren gives her the lamb and Alan gives her his blanket
D: Lauren gives Lulu her blanket and Alan gives her the lamb

article_question:
[CLS]Mary loved walking through the woods with her dog, Max.  Max and Mary would go on all
ewlinesorts of adventures together.  They really loved looking for blueberries together and then
ewlinefalling asleep next to each other in the tall grass.  One day, as Mary was picking the
ewlineblueberries, she turned around to find that Max was not there.  She became worried and ran
ewlineoff to look for her dog.  
ewline
ewlineShe looked in all of their favorite spots...next to the stream, in their secret hiding place
ewlinebehind the raspberry bushes, and even inside the old cabin that sat in the woods.  But
ewlinepoor Max was nowhere to be found.  Nonetheless, Mary would not give up.   She kept looking
ewlineand she found him not very far away.  He had seen a squirrel and run to chase it.  When
ewlineMary called Max's name he left the squirrel and happily returned to Mary, wagging his tail
ewlineas he went.[SEP]What kind of animal is Max?

[CLS]Cindy and Mary were playing at recess. They were having a great time until Cindy brought
ewlineup Allison's birthday party. Cindy had been invited to it, but Mary had not. This hurt
ewlineMary's feelings a lot. The girls kept on playing and Mary was trying to have fun, but all
ewlineshe felt like doing was crying. She couldn't believe that she had not been invited to
ewlineAllison's birthday party. She thought that they were friends and if her best friend Cindy
ewlinehad been invited, why not her?
ewline
ewlineAfter recess was over, the class walked back into the school. Mary saw Allison in line and
ewlinetried to smile, but it was hard. Cindy felt horrible now that she had talked about the
ewlineparty that her friend was not going to.
ewline
ewlineMary found it hard to pay attention to the teacher now. She kept thinking over and over
ewlinewhy Allison didn't invite her to the party. Did Mary do something to make Allison mad or
ewlineto hurt her? She couldn't understand it. Her eyes started to get wet with tears. She was
ewlinehoping that no one saw this. Mary thought she saw Allison looking at her in a funny
ewlineway. Suddenly Mary felt like she was going to start crying. She reached into her desk to
ewlinepull out some tissues. She felt a strange  piece of paper. She pulled it out and there was
ewlinethe invitation to Allison's party. It had gotten mixed up in her papers in her desk. She
ewlineimmediately started to smile. She smiled at Allison and at Cindy. Cindy gave her a puzzled
ewlinelook because she thought that Mary was sad. 
ewline
ewlineAt lunch Mary explained everything to Cindy. Then Mary, Allison, and Cindy all went off to
ewlineplay.[SEP]What did Mary find in her desk?

[CLS]Paws the cat lives with the Jones family. Before Paws lived with the Jones family he lived
ewlinewith the Smith family and before he lived with the Smith family he lived with the Peters
ewlinefamily. The Jones family used to live in a cabin in the woods. Then they moved to an
ewlineapartment in the city. Now they live in a house outside of the city. Paws liked all of the
ewlinefamilies that he had lived with but likes the Jones family the best. Paws likes living
ewlinewith the Jones family so much because they are nice to him and always play with him but
ewlinealso because they have lived in such great places. Paws liked living in the cabin in the
ewlinewoods and in the apartment in the city but neither of these were his were his favorite
ewlineplace to live. Paws favorite place to live is in the new house the Jones family bought
ewlineoutside of the city. The home is very large and Paws has a lot of room to run and play.[SEP]What type of home does the Jones family live in?

[CLS]Timothy likes to play sports. He spends his time after school playing basketball and
ewlinebaseball. Sometimes Timothy pretends he is a famous baseball pitcher for his favorite team
ewlinewith his friends. He plays with his friends Mandy and Andrew. Timothy also plays pretend
ewlinewhen he is alone. He has an imaginary friend named Sean. Sean is an elephant who watches
ewlinetelevision with Timothy.
ewline
ewlineMandy likes playing baseball but she also likes to paint. Mandy's favorite class at school
ewlineis art. She likes making pictures of flowers. Her teacher says she is a good artist. She
ewlinepainted a picture of a tree for her teacher. There were red and yellow leaves on it. It
ewlinehad apples on it.
ewline
ewlineWhen Andrew goes home after baseball, he likes to eat a snack. He eats carrots and
ewlinebananas. If he is a good boy his mom, Mrs. Smith, sometimes gives him milk and
ewlinecookies. Afterwards, Andrew finishes his homework.[SEP]What does Timothy do with Mandy and Andrew?

[CLS]Here begins the story of the life of Tim. Tim's father was Frank. Frank's father was
ewlineJim. Jim's father was Greg. And Greg's father was Mark. These 5 men had ruled Markton for
ewlinethe last 100 years. For the last 20 years, Tim had been the ruler. When Frank died, Tim
ewlinebecame the ruler. In these last 20 years, Tim brought lots of good luck to his
ewlinepeople. They had never eaten so well. Most of his people ate 3 meals a day. Recently, Tim
ewlinehad been having trouble with a band of troublemakers led by Horace. Tim chose to do
ewlinewhatever he could to get rid of Horace. So, he got Assassin to get rid of Horace. One
ewlinenight Assassin sneaked into Horace's bedroom and did away with him. With the bad man gone,
ewlineall the people had a giant party and sang a song about the greatness of their ruler.[SEP]How many years has Tim ruled?

[CLS]Once upon a time there were three rabbits, named Winston, Chester, and Francis. Chester
ewlinewas a brown rabbit with large eyes. Francis was grey and white and had messy fur. Winston
ewlinewas black and very fat. They were very happy rabbits who loved to eat. Every day they
ewlinewould leave their home, cross a road, and go through a small forest to get to a meadow of
ewlinegrass. They loved to eat that grass. One day, Chester thought he smelled something
ewlineinteresting. At first he thought it might be dirt. Then he thought maybe some sort of
ewlineflower. So, he asked a nearby squirrel. The squirrel's name was Acorn. Acorn said that he
ewlinethought it was mushrooms. However, Francis, the smartest rabbit, went to go look, and he
ewlinelearned that it was actually a garden of carrots. The rabbits were all excited. They all
ewlineloved carrots! They ate all the carrots.[SEP]What color is Winston?

[CLS]Hawthorne rolled over in bed and looked around the room.  He let out a breath.
ewlineHis eyes were half-closed as he shoved the covers back from his bed, and moved
ewlinetowards the door.  He knew that he had to check on Kate, if he did nothing else. She was
ewlineill, with a heart problem, and he worried about her all the time.
ewline
ewlineThey both lived in a home for orphans, and he had since his parents had died, when he was
ewlinethe age of four. He had taken care of Kate as if she were his sister ever since. He
ewlinewandered to her room sitting himself by her on her bed, shoving her hair from her
ewlineface.
ewline
ewlineShe moved on the bed as he pulled her into his arms, "Kate." He said into her ear, "It's
ewlinetime to wake up." He pressed a kiss to her head, and her eyes opened.
ewline
ewline"Hawthy?" She said, her nickname for him moving from her lips.
ewline
ewline"Yea." He moved her hair.
ewline
ewline"I want to go outside today," she said, and he nodded in response.
ewline
ewline"If you are up to it, I won't stop you", he told her, and she smiled.
ewline
ewline"Thanks Hawthy", she said.
ewline
ewlineIt wasn't long until she fell back to sleep.[SEP]What is wrong with the girl?

[CLS]Mary was a little girl who loved to sew. She liked to sew dresses, shirts, and skirts but
ewlineMary hated to sew quilts. She didn't like anything about sewing quilts and blankets
ewlinebecause it took too long. One quilt or blanket took a week to make, when a skirt or shirt
ewlinetook one night! Mary's mother didn't understand why Mary didn't like to sew quilts and
ewlineblankets because Mary's mother loved to!
ewline
ewlineMary was a normal little girl even if her friends didn't think so all the time. Mary's
ewlinefriends liked to play games and play outside but all Mary liked was to sew. She woke up
ewlineand she began to sew. She only stopped to eat and use the bathroom. Mary's father was very
ewlineworried about Mary. He said that little girls needed to laugh and play, not sew all the
ewlinetime. 
ewline
ewlineOne day Mary's father took Mary's sewing things and gave them to the poor children. "No
ewlinemore sewing, Mary!" He said. He wanted her to go laugh and play with her friends instead of
ewlinesew but instead of going outside to play she ran into her room and cried. Mary was very
ewlinesad that she couldn't sew any more. Soon her friends came over to see why Mary hadn't come
ewlineover to play like her father said she would. When they saw her crying on her bed they had
ewlineto think of a way to cheer her up. Billy said that maybe they could let her sew at their
ewlinehouses. Abby thought it was a great idea. So then all Mary's friends bought sewing things
ewlinewith their money so that Mary would be happy again. When Mary's father saw Mary go to one
ewlineof her friend's house he was very happy. Soon everyone was happy again.[SEP]Why did Mary's father not want Mary to sew?
A: Because she never did anything but sew.
B: Because her friends didn't think she was normal.
C: Because he thought little girls needed to laugh and play.
D: Because he didn't like her sewing.

article_question:
[CLS]In a far away land known as Board, there was a great man named Pawn. This was a very odd
ewlineland because the only thing to do was play chess. Pawn did not very much care for chess as
ewlinehe was very bored with it. Another problem Pawn had was that he didn't like some of the
ewlineother people in this land. They had names like Bishop, Queen, Rook, and Knight. And most
ewlineof all, there was King. He was the greatest person in Board. One day, during their normal
ewlinebattle, Pawn saw an opening to move to the far end of Board. He almost got hurt by Knight
ewlinebut he got away. Amazingly, when he got to the other end he became as powerful as
ewlineQueen. With this amazing power, Pawn chose to help keep King safe. All was well until Pawn
ewlinewoke up and knew that it was only a dream. He was still Pawn.[SEP]Who was the greatest person in Board?

[CLS]In a quiet house there was a dog named Bentley. Bentley was a little brown puppy and he
ewlinewas always getting into trouble. One day Bentley got outside and walked down the
ewlinestreet. He found a trash can and started to dig through it. A cat came also to see what
ewlineBentley was doing. "Excuse me, but what are you looking for?" asked the cat. "Well, nothing
ewlineimportant," Bentley told the cat. "I wanted to see if there was anything cool in there."
ewlineThe cat told Bentley that his name was Felix and asked if he could dig through the trash
ewlinetoo. "Sure thing" Bentley told the cat. The two of them started to dig through the trash
ewlineagain. After a little bit the pair got bored and started to walk down the street going
ewlineaway from Bentley's house. They walked to a river and went to the edge of the water. They
ewlinesaw they were dirty because they had been digging in the trash so they went into the water
ewlineto wash themselves. When they were clean they went back to Bentley's house. Inside the
ewlinehouse they got water on everything because they were still wet. Bentley's human's came
ewlinehome and were very upset that their house was now very wet.[SEP]What was the name of the cat Bentley met?

[CLS]School is out for the summer.  Jake and Jimmy are playing on a baseball team. They are
ewlineboth nine years old this year.  Their team is called the Knights.  Jake plays first base
ewlineand Jimmy is a pitcher.  They both love baseball.  They started playing when they were
ewlinefour years old.  It is so fun for them.  Their team has won three games so far.  They beat
ewlinethe Jets, the Bluejays, and the Hawks so far.  They have not lost any games yet.  They are
ewlineplaying the Tigers today.  The Tigers have not lost any games either.  The score was one
ewlineto one until the last inning.  There were two outs.  Jimmy came to the plate.  The pitcher
ewlinenamed Johnny threw the ball hard.  Jimmy swung his bat too late and missed.  He missed the
ewlinenext pitch too.  It was too fast.  He was ready for the next pitch.  He hit it hard to
ewlinecenter field.  The Tiger player in center field jumped to catch it, but it went over his
ewlinehead and over the fence.  It was a home run!  The Knights won the game![SEP]What team are the Knights playing today?

[CLS]Tommy's birthday is next week.  He is hoping for a very special gift.  What are some
ewlinethings Tommy is hoping for?
ewline
ewlineHe would like a big, bouncy ball, like his friends Bobby and Joey have.  One with blue
ewlinestripes!
ewline
ewlineHe would really like some new sneakers.  Danny, Tommy's best friend, got a special pair of
ewlinesneakers for HIS birthday last month.  They have pictures of robots on them and even light
ewlineup when you walk!
ewline
ewlineHe would really, REALLY like a shiny new bicycle.  Tommy has an old bicycle now. He is
ewlinegetting too big for it.  He saw a red one in the store yesterday when he was shopping with
ewlinehis Mom.  It looked like it was the right size for him!
ewline
ewlineBut what Tommy wants most of all is a new baby brother.  Today his Mom and Dad said that
ewlinehe might have one very, very soon.  Then Tommy and his little brother can have many fun
ewlinebirthdays together.  That would be the best gift of all![SEP]Who is Tommy's best friend?

[CLS]On a snowy winter morning, the brown-haired lady saw a squirrel that was hurt. It only had
ewlinethree legs, and it looked hungry. She put some corn out for the squirrel to eat, but other
ewlinebully squirrels came, too. The brown-haired lady started giving the little squirrel
ewlinepeanuts to eat. She gave some to the bully squirrels, too, so they would leave the
ewlinethree-legged squirrel alone.
ewline
ewlineThe winter snow melted and then it was spring. The grass turned green and the air was
ewlinewarm. Now, when the little squirrel with three legs would come to see the brown-haired
ewlinelady with the peanuts, it would take the peanuts and dig a little hole and hide the
ewlinepeanuts for later. The squirrel would hold the peanut in its mouth and dig and dig and
ewlinedig, and then it would put the peanut in the hole and pat it down with its little front
ewlinepaw. Then it would run back over to the brown-haired lady and get some more peanuts to
ewlineeat.[SEP]What other squirrels were there?

[CLS]A little boy named Joey did not like to brush his teeth. One day, as his mother asked him
ewlineto brush his teeth, Joey said, "I don't want to! It's gross and a waste of time!" In
ewlineresponse, Joey's mom told him that in order for him to grow up and be big and strong like
ewlineshe is, he must brush his teeth. In disgust, with his mom watching to make sure he brushed
ewlinehis teeth right, he brushed his teeth and whined until he was finished. The next day, Joey
ewlinedid not brush his teeth and told his mom that he did. After going to school, one of Joey's
ewlinefriends said that his breath stunk and began to make fun of him. This made Joey very
ewlineangry, so he pushed the boy over and started to cry. A teacher came over and called the
ewlineprincipal as both kids were being loud and starting a fight. Joey's mom came to school and
ewlinetook him home. After asking what was wrong, Joey told his mom that he didn't brush his
ewlineteeth. After hearing this, his mom marched him up to the bathroom and forced him to brush
ewlinehis teeth. "You won't get teased if you brush your teeth, Joey!" she yelled, and then left
ewlinethe room. From that day forward, Joey brushed his teeth every day so the other kids
ewlinewouldn't make fun of him.[SEP]What did Joey do after his mom yelled at him?
B: He didn't go back to school.
C: He only brushed his teeth sometimes.
D: He brushed his teeth every day after that.
